content:
The graph below contains the line $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$, $\overleftrightarrow{CD}$, and the point $P$.  
  
**Draw the image of $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$ under a dilation whose center is $P$ and scale factor is $\dfrac{1}{2}$.**  
  
[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
  
**Which of the following statements about the image of $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$ are true?**  

[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: The image is the same line as $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$.
The image is a line perpendicular to $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$.
The image is a line parallel to $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$.
The image is a line perpendicular to $\overleftrightarrow{CD}$.
The intersection of the image of $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$ and $\overleftrightarrow{CD}$ forms a $103^{\circ}$ angle.
The image is a line parallel to $\overleftrightarrow{CD}$.
The intersection of the image of $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$ and $\overleftrightarrow{CD}$ forms a $125^{\circ}$ angle.
The intersection of the image of $\overleftrightarrow{AB}$ and $\overleftrightarrow{CD}$ has a corresponding angle congruent to $x$.  *(Suppose angle $103^\circ$ is labeled $x$)*
